thread.title: BT to merge public sector and wholesale units in latest restructuring

title: BT to merge public sector and wholesale units in latest restructuring
text:
April 18, 2018 / 6:31 AM / Updated an hour ago BT to merge public sector and wholesale units in latest restructuring Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
LONDON (Reuters) - BT ( BT.L ) will merge two of its divisions which provide public sector work and wholesale services in the latest restructuring designed to improve customer services, it said on Wednesday. FILE PHOTO - A BT (British Telecom) company logo is pictured on the side of a convention centre in Liverpool northern England, April 9, 2016. REUTERS/Phil Noble/File Photo 
BT said Gerry McQuade, currently the boss of the Wholesale and Ventures unit, would run the new department called BT Enterprise. 
“Combining our enterprise businesses will allow us to strengthen the services and products we offer to businesses and sharpen our focus on customer service, through clear accountabilities and by introducing efficiencies,” BT Chief Executive Gavin Patterson said. 
McQuade will lead BT Enterprise from May 1 and it will report as a single unit from Oct. 1. Reporting by Kate Holton; editing by James Davey
